statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -6 \\ 2 \\ 9 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -1 \\ -2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -3 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 3 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 5 \\ 8 \\ 4 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -6 \\ 2 \\ 9 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -1 \\ -2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -3 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 3 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 5 \\ 8 \\ 4 \end{array}\right].
